alert.note: Alert for Caribou Range; Teton Valley (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 30 at 1:40PM MST until December 31 at 5:00AM MST by NWS Pocatello
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 AM MST FRIDAY... * WHAT...Snow. Additional snow accumulations of 4 to 8 inches. Above 8000 feet elevation, up to 10 inches of snow will accumulate in the mountains bordering the east side of the Teton Valley. South to southwest wind up to 20 mph with higher gusts will cause heavy drifting snow and low visibility in blowing snow. * WHERE...Caribou Range and the Teton Valley-Including the cities of Wayan, Swan Valley, Ashton, Tetonia, and Driggs. * WHEN...Until 5 AM MST Friday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Patchy blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. Heavy drifting of snow may overcome efforts to keep roads and highways clear.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
